label: 御院
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A detached palace or Imperial Residence (Gosho) that has been selected by the Sovereign (Tennō) to be his home after he has abdicated (jōi). While he is still the Sovereign, the palace is called the Go-in, but not after he has abdicated. [御所、天皇、譲位]
